titleStmt.title: Indien 4. விரதம் இரண்டு Viratam Iraṇṭu, "Two vratams"

repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

supportDesc.condition: Excellent state of preservation. Very few bore holes caused by insects.

binding.p: Woodcovers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

acquisition.p: Bequest of Edouard Ariel. Made first to Société Asiatique de Paris in 1855, later transfered to Bibliothèque Nationale (see Rosny 1869).

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 2.

revisionDesc.change: This catalogue entry has been redacted by Emmanuel FRANCIS (CNRS, CEIAS UMR 8564, EHESS & CNRS) for the research program Texts Surrounding Texts (TST, FRAL 2018, ANR/DFG). Version 1, April 2020.

body.p: The palm-leaf bundle, a composite manuscript, contains, on the front woodcover:
U1: 1 folio, unfoliated = title-page, by hand n° 1. With shelfmark: C/48.
Paratexts: marginal benediction; title.
It contains, between the two woodcovers:
U2: ராமதேவர் பூசாவிதி Rāmatēvar Pūcāviti, by hand n° 2, see below.
U3: நாற்கரணவுபதேசம் Nāṟkaraṇavupatēcam, by hand n° 3, see below.

The Rāmatēvar Pūcāviti, "Rules for worship by Rāmatēvar", appears to be a manual for worship by Rāmatēvar, in 200 stanzas.
The text is complete.
Paratexts: marginal and in-text benedictions; marginal title; marginal chapter headers; colophon.
Folio 1, recto, unfoliated = incipit: benedictions and title in left margin; stanza n° 1.
